channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside of Kings Gardens, near the bus stop, 17th June
item.description:
The pothole has been present for some time and when filled with water can cause people to be splashed when waiting for the bus / walking along the footpath
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West End Lane, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree cut down by council, 17th June
item.description:
We have had another tree cut down by the council and not replaced on what was a tree lined street. On both sides of the road where it meets Woolwich road we have lost 5 trees in recent years not one has been replaced. Yet when I walk to a neighbouring street Nursery avenue trees are being continuly replanted by the council. When will we have our missing trees replanted?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pelham Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The fly tipping trail, 17th June
item.description:
Absolute joke how you cannot walk on the side walks in this area.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Blurton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling, 17th June
item.description:
The lady in the video allowed her dog to poop, did not pick up, and when approached directly refused to even speak to us. We welcome a visit from the Council, as this is a recurring problem in our street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, Rutland Gate, Knightsbridge, London

item.title: Kids playing football in car park, 17th June
item.description:
Kids playing football between cars in car park and is dangerous 'it's a accendent waiting to happen. Please can you put sign up 'no ball games. Danny mccarthy court se16 7lu.thankyou'q

item.title: Same old, same old. Fly tipping at Lamlash Community Garden., 17th June
item.description:
Regular dumping site. I reported fly tipping her last Friday. There is an address in the packaging. Person obviously thinks it acceptable to dump rubbish.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elliott's Row, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous giant hogweed and other invasive plants, 17th June
item.description:
Giant Hogweed and Himalyan Balsam is rife in this area, along bothsides of the riverbank including a public footpath, the horses field and along the roadside in Maiden Lane. Part of the area forms the L&Q land however they are not maintaining. I am pretty sure it borders both Bexley and Dartford Council so probably exists as "no-mans land" however it is being neglected, multiplying like crazy and is dangerous to the public. There are no signs up warning the public either so please advise. We are in danger of these plants seeding yet again for a bigger problem next year!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant fly tipping, 17th June
item.description:
Constant fly tipping in this corner, obstructing the road. This part of Blurton Road is the dump of the whole area. We also deserve a clean street!!!!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powerscroft Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken footpath, 17th June
item.description:
I hope you can help The paving slabs (foot path) have broken, outside number 72 Faversham, these were not broken until recent, I building works are occurring near by. As you can see from the photos a double rear tyre mark is on the slab, when heavy machinery is being dropped off. I look forward to hear from you. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, Faversham Avenue, Southbury, Enfield, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked footpath, 17th June
item.description:
This will be the 3rd time of reporting in over a year and there has still been no action from Bromley. Barriers left behind by contractor repairing drain are blocking footpath. Please arrange for these barriers to be removed.

item.title: The railway footpath greenery needs cutting back ASAP, 17th June
item.description:
Guys tree branches , nearly took my eye out today, as kids ride bikes down this path daily, think it needs cutting back Asap , as its clearly a H&S issue. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Longfield Crescent, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Domestic waste by overflowing bins; despite yesterday’s “collection”, 17th June
item.description:
Residents of properties above the shops at the top of Westcombe Hill have nowhere to leave domestic waste but the pavement by the street litter bin. Foxes attack it and yesterday’s collection left most of it strewn about. Our dust personnel are great but as a local shop keeper says, this happens every week so you need a more strategic long-term solution for properties like this with no access to wheelie bins.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 158, Westcombe Hill, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
